meanings.definition: A spasm of the diaphragm causing a sudden inhalation that is typically accompanied by a sound.
meanings.sent1: Every time he laughed, a hiccup would escape his mouth.
meanings.sent2: She had a hiccup during the presentation, but she quickly recovered.
meanings.sent3: The hiccup in the music made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The sudden hiccup in the plan caught us off guard.
meanings.sent5: The hiccup echoed through the room, making everyone turn to look.

meanings.definition: A temporary or minor setback or problem.
meanings.sent1: The delay in the delivery was just a hiccup in our schedule.
meanings.sent2: After a small hiccup, they continued on their journey without any issues.
meanings.sent3: The hiccup in the recipe made the dish taste strange.
meanings.sent4: The hiccup in negotiations caused a delay in the agreement.
meanings.sent5: Despite the hiccup, they managed to finish the project on time.
